name: Creamy Beef & Shells
description: This recipe is good for your soul, your belly, and your wallet! It’s a cozy, hearty dish on a budget, so it’ll warm you right up. Cooking pasta right in the broth infuses the noodles with more complex flavours, while the pasta shells catch all that creamy, delicious sauce for a delightful, one-pot, pasta experience.

ingredients.name: small pasta shells
ingredients.additionalInstruction: or bite-size pasta of your choice

preparation: Cook ground beef in Sauté Pan over medium-high heat until browned, about 3–4 min, using Ground Meat Separator to break up chunks.
Add broth, tomato sauce, pasta, and milk; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; partially cover and simmer 11–12 min, or until pasta is tender and sauce has thickened.
Stir in cheese until melted and well combined.
tips: If pasta is not cooked within 12 min, cook an additional 1–2 min. If there is too much water left over when the pasta is done, uncover and cook a few more minutes to let excess liquid evaporate.
Swap tomato sauce with 1 1⁄2 cups prepared Marinara Sauce.
